001package edu.cnm.deepdive.jata.controller;
002
003import android.os.Bundle;
004import android.view.LayoutInflater;
005import android.view.View;
006import android.view.ViewGroup;
007import android.widget.ArrayAdapter;
008import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
009import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
010import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment;
011import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider;
012import androidx.navigation.NavController;
013import androidx.navigation.Navigation;
014import dagger.hilt.android.AndroidEntryPoint;
015import edu.cnm.deepdive.jata.R;
016import edu.cnm.deepdive.jata.databinding.FragmentHomeBinding;
017import edu.cnm.deepdive.jata.viewmodel.GameViewModel;
018import edu.cnm.deepdive.jata.viewmodel.LoginViewModel;
019import edu.cnm.deepdive.jata.viewmodel.PermissionsViewModel;
020import edu.cnm.deepdive.jata.viewmodel.PreferencesViewModel;
021import edu.cnm.deepdive.jata.viewmodel.UserViewModel;
022
023/**
024 * Demonstrates access to and observation of {@link androidx.lifecycle.LiveData} elements in
025 * {@link GameViewModel}, as well as acting as a navigation placeholder. This fragment inflates the home
026 * screen for the app, and holds the settings for boardSize and player count for the user to set. It also
027 * has a start game button which navigates you to the GameFragment.
028 */
029@AndroidEntryPoint
030public class HomeFragment extends Fragment {
031
032  private FragmentHomeBinding binding;
033  private NavController navController;
034  private GameViewModel viewModel;
035  private int boardSizeValue;
036  private int playerCountValue;
037
038  @Nullable
039  @Override
040  public View onCreateView(@NonNull LayoutInflater inflater, @Nullable ViewGroup container,
041      @Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {
042    binding = FragmentHomeBinding.inflate(inflater, container, false);
043    String[] boardSizeNames = getResources().getStringArray(R.array.board_size_names);
044    int[] boardSizeValues = getResources().getIntArray(R.array.board_size_values);
045    binding.boardSize.setAdapter(new ArrayAdapter<>(
046        requireContext(), android.R.layout.simple_dropdown_item_1line, boardSizeNames));
047    String[] playerCount = getResources().getStringArray(R.array.player_count);
048    binding.playerCount.setAdapter(new ArrayAdapter<>(
049        requireContext(), android.R.layout.simple_dropdown_item_1line, playerCount));
050    // TODO: 4/4/2024 attach click listener to button to start game.
051    binding.startGame.setOnClickListener((v) -> {
052      boardSizeValue = boardSizeValues[binding.boardSize.getSelectedItemPosition()];
053      playerCountValue = Integer.parseInt((String) binding.playerCount.getSelectedItem());
054      viewModel.startGame(boardSizeValue, playerCountValue);
055    });
056    return binding.getRoot();
057  }
058
059  @Override
060  public void onViewCreated(@NonNull View view, @Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {
061    super.onViewCreated(view, savedInstanceState);
062    navController = Navigation.findNavController(view);
063    viewModel = new ViewModelProvider(requireActivity()).get(GameViewModel.class);
064    viewModel.getGame()
065        .observe(getViewLifecycleOwner(), (game) -> {
066          if (game != null && !game.isFinished()) {
067            navController.navigate(HomeFragmentDirections.navigateToGame(boardSizeValue, playerCountValue));
068          }
069        });
070  }
071
072}
